title: Shane Leahy
text:
Shane Leahy (born 27 November 1971) is an Irish former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player.
Career.
Leahy attended <a href="Crescent%20College">Crescent College</a> in <a href="Limerick">Limerick</a> and won <a href="Munster%20Schools%20Rugby%20Senior%20Cup">Munster Schools Rugby Senior Cup</a> titles in 1989 and 1990. His father, Mick, earned one cap for <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a> against <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a> during the <a href="1964%20Five%20Nations%20Championship">1964 Five Nations Championship</a>, whilst older brother Kelvin also earned a single cap for Ireland against <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand</a> in 1992, and brothers Shane and Ross also won <a href="Munster%20Schools%20Rugby%20Senior%20Cup">Munster Schools Rugby Senior Cup</a> titles with Crescent College.
He played for <a href="Dublin">Dublin</a> club <a href="Lansdowne%20Football%20Club">Lansdowne</a> in the <a href="All-Ireland%20League%20%28rugby%20union%29">All-Ireland League</a>, but work took Leahy back to <a href="Limerick">Limerick</a>, where he joined <a href="Garryowen%20Football%20Club">Garryowen</a>. He played for <a href="Ireland%20Wolfhounds">Ireland A</a> against <a href="South%20Africa%20A%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa A</a> in November 1996, and made five appearances for <a href="Connacht%20Rugby">Connacht</a> during the 1996–97 Challenge Cup, before joining <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster</a> ahead of the <a href="1997%E2%80%9398%20Munster%20Rugby%20season">1997–98</a> season and making 17 appearances for the province between 1997 and 1999. After rugby, Leahy became <a href="Chief%20executive%20officer">CEO</a> of Oxygen8.
